list_definition.definition: a person who serves people with food etc at table

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She is a waitress in a café
Which waiter served you in the restaurant?

list_ex_of_english: The situation is a restaurant, and my party has just finished giving its orders to a white-jacketed waiter.
The waiters having been removed and a kid glove affixed to the door-knocker.
The result was a quite satisfying improvement in waiter recognition.
It signals that "we are all in this together", one cannot imagine it in modern use as the plural of boy "waiter" or "servant".
The closest that our decisionmakers get to the heartbeat of the nation is when they tip a waiter.
The waiter brought over a grubby document, creased at the corners and covered with tea stains.
Over the next few minutes, cleaning personnel, waiters with trays of food, a manicurist, a plumber, and others enter the cabin.
Should men in their forties and fifties 5ecome waiters?
